Job ID: JR0172826 Job Category: Intern/Student Primary Location: Phoenix, AZ US Other Locations: Job Type: Intern Hardware Validation Engineer Intern Job Description Technology and Manufacturing Group (TMG) at Intel Corporation in Chandler, AZ, is looking for a candidate to do a 6 to 12 months internship starting in the Summer/Fall of 2021. This candidate will work full-time during the summer months and work part-time while attending school full-time. Responsibilities may be quite diverse of a technical nature.

Job assignments are usually for the summer or for short periods during breaks from school. The candidate will be part of the test engineering team working on world-class Automatic Test Equipment (ATE) in Chandler, Arizona. This is an internship and compensation will be given accordingly based on candidate education level and internship duration.

You must possess the below requirements to be initially considered for this position. Qualifications You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.

Knowledge and/or experience listed below would be obtained through a combination of your school work and/or classes and/or research and/or relevant previous job and/or internship experiences. Minimum Qualifications: Candidates must be pursuing a Master's degree or PhD degree in Electrical or Computer System Engineering or Computer engineering degrees. 3+ months of experience in digital logic design and scripting skills, python basic coding skills CC.

Inside this Business Group As the world's largest chip manufacturer, Intel strives to make every facet of semiconductor manufacturing state-of-the-art -- from semiconductor process development and manufacturing, through yield improvement to packaging, final test and optimization, and world class Supply Chain and facilities support. Employees in the Technology and Manufacturing Group are part of a worldwide network of design, development, manufacturing, and assembly/test facilities, all focused on utilizing the power of Moore's Law to bring smart, connected devices to every person on Earth Posting Statement All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, military and veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender, gender expression, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by local law, regulation, or ordinance. USInternJR0172826Phoenix

DEFINITION

Under direct supervision: to provide technical, operational, and internal customer service computer support to District departments; to introduce, implement, and maintain computers and related hardware and software, operating systems and networks; and to perform a variety of related technical tasks.

 

DISTINGUISHING CHARACTERISTICS

This is the entry-level position for performing a variety of work in the Information Systems Department. Incumbents work under close supervision, performing various tasks associated with maintaining the District's information systems. 

 

Receives immediate, technical and functional supervision from the Information Systems Specialist. May receive immediate supervision from other assigned management or supervisory staff. 

DUTIES MAY INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO THE FOLLOWING:

Duties may include, but are not limited to, the following:

 

  • Perform a variety of responsible technical duties in support of District computer set-ups and troubleshooting.
  •  Monitor information technology systems to ensure integrity and tune the system to meet performance requirements.
  • Prepares new computer workstations for use with the District network and installs necessary software; installs and maintains software on existing computer workstations.
  • Perform printer set up and deployment. Tasks may also include printer troubleshooting and diagnostics including downloading drivers, replacing toner, cleaning or replacing rollers and clearing jams. 
  • Answer questions and respond in a timely manner; provide technical support and information, assistance and training over the phone and in person related to computer technology related issues. 
  • Analyze, diagnose, test, and recommend solutions for problems with computers, tablets, operating systems, software and hardware problems. 
  • Perform UPS battery replacement and deployment. 
  • Create user ID's and troubleshoot network and application logins. 
  • Create, modify, copy or delete files. 
  • Install, upgrade, configure, and program software, applications and hardware. 
  • Monitor systems for viruses and take corrective action, as needed. 
  • Build and maintain positive working relationships with co-workers, vendors, and the public using principles of good customer service. 
  • Perform related duties as assigned.

TYPICAL PHYSICAL ACTIVITIES

  • Positions in this class typically require: stooping, bending, kneeling, crouching, standing, lifting, fingering, grasping, talking, hearing, seeing, and repetitive motions
  • Communicates orally with management, co-workers, and the public in face-to-face, one-on-one, and group settings
  • Regularly uses a telephone for communication
  • Operate and use modern office equipment including a computer, computer terminals, copiers, and various software packages.
  • Must be capable of reading, writing, and understanding material that is highly technical in nature
  • Must be able to carry, push, pull, reach, and lift equipment and materials up to 50 lbs.
  • Sits for extended periods of time
  • Hearing and vision within normal ranges

EMPLOYMENT STANDARDS KNOWLEDGE OF:

  • Methods and techniques of computer equipment and related hardware.
  • Common software used in personal computers, such as Microsoft Office, Word, Excel, Power Point, and others.
  • Telecommunications equipment
  • Proper safe use of the tools, materials, and equipment used to accomplish assigned duties or projects
  • Principles and practices of good customer service.

ABILITY TO:

  • Maintain computer systems and software applications
  • Troubleshoot computer hardware, software, network problems
  • Maintain personal computers and network servers, as well as related peripheral and communications equipment
  • Assist the Information Systems Specialist in updating technical documentation and policies. 
  • Maintain confidentiality of records and information
  • Effectively learn and apply related policies, procedures and practices affecting information systems
  • Communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing.
  • Prepare and maintain accurate and complete records and reports

DESIRABLE EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

Any combination of education and experience, which would likely provide the necessary knowledge and abilities, is qualifying.

A typical way to obtain the knowledge and abilities would be:

Experience troubleshooting IT issues or performing technical or support tasks for computer systems.

High school graduation or equivalent supplemented by college level course work or specialized training in computer science, information technology, database design or related fields.

Bachelor's degree with major coursework in computer science, information technology or a related field.

 

SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS

  • Ability to pass a pre-employment physical.
  • Valid California Driver's License - Class "C".  Must maintain an acceptable driving record as determined by the District's insurance carrier.
  • Reliable telephone in service at all times.
  • Reliable personal transportation.

WORK SCHEDULE

Up to 20 hours per week. 

Tentative schedule: Monday, Tuesday, and Thursday- hours may vary. 

Overtime assignments

The purveyance of water is a vital service to the community and as such requires the availability of District personnel at all times.  Consequently, Information Systems employees, including the Information Systems Intern will be required to respond to emergency calls, accept periodic overtime assignments, and perform any and all other duties deemed necessary by the District.  Lacking a bona fide excuse satisfactory to the District, a failure to report when called could result in termination.

 

FAIR LABOR STANDARDS ACT

For the purposes of the Fair Labor Standards Act, the Information Systems Intern shall be considered a "non-exempt" position.

Abound is seeking rising seniors or recent college graduates who are ready to explore a career in ecommerce, including but not limited to: warehouse management, returns processing, inventory management, fulfillment, and customer experience. Our internship could be the first step on a career path that offers tremendous growth opportunities!

The ideal candidate is forward-thinking, communicative and excited about being a part of a unique effort to build a returns & fulfillment model for a one-of-a-kind marketplace in the ecommerce wholesale warehousing industry.

What you will learn:

  • How to carry-out returns processing & order fulfillment from start to finish
  • How to inspect inbound returns for damage, defects, misrepresentation
  • How to utilize inventory management software to process and locate merchandise
  • How to label and organize inventory according to shelving location system
  • How to utilize project management software to process, track, document efforts from start to finish
  • How to pick and pack ecommerce orders, upholding fantastic fulfillment standards and helping implement sustainable fulfillment efforts
  • How to document feedback, pain-points, and successes on returns processing, order fulfillment, shelving organization, and inventory management systems to later present in strategy sessions with the team

Requirements:

  • This position requires that candidates must be authorized to work in the United States on an ongoing basis without requiring sponsorship in the future
  • Must be able to lift objects/boxes up to 25 pounds
  • Must be able to commute to Burbank, CA and work in-person, subject to COVID-19 protocols
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Competitive GPA
  • Proficient computer literacy, open to learning new software programs. Familiarity with Notion, Monday, Slack, Kustomer, Excel and Google Suite helpful but not required.

Who you are:

  • You are driven and ready to dive into hands-on work with a small team
  • You have a strong ability to operate independently, and you are passionate about growing professionally
  • You are very organized and detail-oriented
  • You are extremely reliable and you communicate challenges well
  • You resonate with Abound's mission and have a genuine interest in one or more of the facets of our returns & resale operations
  • You are team-oriented and thrive on collaboration with an open-minded and supportive team

About us:

Abound helps indie retailers stock their stores by making product sourcing as easy as online shopping. With Abound, indie store owners get access to thousands of the very best emerging brands. And, emerging brands are able to get their products into retail shops around the country.

Based in NYC, we're a small, fast-growing company. We're excited to be building a team as diverse as the thousands of brands and retailers who use Abound every day.

Terms & benefits:

  • 3-month, part-time Internship, $20/hour
  • In-person in Burbank, CA
  • Room to grow and take on new responsibilities within the company with a possibility of permanent work
  • Supportive, flexible team environment
  • Become a core member of a rapidly growing startup

Job Types: Part-time, Internship

Pay: $20.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Plant Facilities Intern


We are searching for an experienced Plant Facilities Intern at our Palmer Plant Bldg facility. 

Primary Duties and Responsibilities: 

SUMMARY OF POSITION'S ROLE

Temporary interns are used periodically to help supplement the workforce throughout MTA.  They will work in close collaboration with the Plant Facilities staff by assisting with research and records correction of various Business Intelligence (BI) generated discrepancy reports between the plant facilities equipment, customer location and billing data.

 SPECIFIC TASK DESCRIPTION 

    1. Assist Plant Facilities with researching the cause(s) of various BI discrepancy reports. Helping to identify patterns in the discrepancies caused by current automation or current workflows failing, or where new automation may help.
    2. Assist with reconciling equipment information into records database where applicable or notifying the appropriate work group of corrections that need to be made by their department. Other database work as required.
    3. Good written and oral communication skills. Ability to be effective and efficient working either independently with mentor oversight, or as a supporting role as a member of a small team.
    4. Other duties as assigned.
  1.  


Required Qualifications:

EDUCATION: Applicants currently enrolled in a Bachelor's program for Electrical or Computer Engineering, or equivalent major will be given first preference. Applicants will be currently enrolled in a full time degree program and returning to the program after the completion of the internship.  When a student intern is required during the normal school year, the applicant may be a part time student. 3.0 GPA or greater preferred. Strong computer skills in MS Office and drafting skills preferred.

WORK EXPERIENCE: Previous related internship/work experience preferred, preference will be given to returning student interns that have performed satisfactorily in the past.

*full (PDF) job description available upon request*

Employment Type: Temporary Student Intern

Compensation Type: Hourly Wage

The Position

Engineering Intern
 
The City of Ontario reserves the right, if necessary, to accept only the first one hundred (100) applications from applicants that meet the qualification guidelines below.

Are you interested in making a positive impact on your community while developing professional skills in the areas of water and sewer infrastructure, environmental programs, and land development? The City of Ontario has an excellent part-time opportunity for an Engineering Intern to assist in and complete a wide variety of administrative, technical, and research-oriented assignments. Interns have the ability to observe in and participate in a variety of tasks that support the overall operation of the assigned department.
 
The ideal candidate shall have knowledge of basic engineering principles, especially as they pertain to hydraulics, pipe design, and the operation and maintenance of municipal utilities; the capability to use AutoCAD and MS Office software programs; the ability to compile and organize data and create reports and spreadsheets; and perform other essential functions as required. In addition, the candidate will have the ability to work effectively and efficiently in a team environment. Additionally, the successful candidate will be a model for the City's Approach to Public Service - Commitment to the Community, Achieving Excellence Through Teamwork, and Doing the Right Thing the Right Way - and emulate the qualities of a 5 Tool Player - Leader, Thinker, Operator, Communicator, and Public Servant. Interns can be assigned to the Ontario Municipal Utilities Company or Engineering.
 
The Administrative Intern is a part-time/temporary position, scheduled to work less than 29 hours per week, and is not eligible to participate in the City's health insurance or retirement plans.
 
The City of Ontario 
 
The City of Ontario is a dynamic leading community in the Inland Empire with a variety of full-time and part-time employment and volunteer opportunities. Ontario enjoys the reputation of being a progressive City which provides solid leadership to its citizens and to the business community. The City provides a full range of services to the community including; Police, Fire, Administrative Services, Community Life & Culture, Development, Economic Development, Housing & Neighborhood Preservation, Public Works and the Ontario Municipal Utilities Company. The City's team is staffed with approximately 1,200 full-time and 200 part-time diverse and talented employees who work to support a common goal of providing excellent service to the community.

We invite you to learn more about the City of Ontario by reviewing the City's website. A few useful links are also listed below:

Approach to Public Service (Core values for City of Ontario employees)

OntarioCityEmployees.org (Information about City of Ontario employee benefit plans)

The Ontario Plan (The City's Comprehensive Business Plan for Development)

Examples of Essential Functions

The essential functions typically performed by the Administrative Intern include the following:

  • Assists members of management, professional, and technical staff by performing basic administrative and technical assignments.
     
  • Utilizes Geographical Information Systems (GIS) for data analysis.
     
  • Operates personal computers, printers, and other office equipment.
     
  • Performs research and preliminary administrative analysis.
     
  • Performs field work which includes photo documentation of construction sites and public streets.
     
  • Reviews and summarizes publications and documents.
     
  • Composes and edits correspondence, memorandums, reports, and other special assignments.
     
  • Gathers and tabulates data.
     
  • Responds to requests for information and general questions from the public.
     
  • Prepares files for storage.
     
  • Assists with specials projects and events.
     
  • Performs other related duties as assigned.
     

Qualification Guidelines

Education

Equivalent to completion of two years of college at an accredited college/university with major course work in Engineering, Environmental Science, or a related field.

Licenses

Valid California Class C driver's license and an acceptable driving record at the time of appointment and throughout employment.

Desirable

Currently enrolled as a junior/senior level undergraduate student, in good standing, at an accredited college/university with a major emphasis in Civil Engineering, Environmental Science or a related field.

Supplemental Information

How to Apply

Apply online by clicking on the "Apply" link at the top of this announcement. If this is the first time applying for a position using governmentjobs.com you will be prompted to create a new user account, otherwise log in with your user name and password. Your application and responses to any supplemental questions will be used to evaluate your qualifications for this position. It is suggested that your application include the following:
 

  • List any relevant experience and education that demonstrates that you qualify for the position.
  • List all periods of employment for at least the past 10 years, beginning with your most recent or present employer (including if applicable, all employment with the City of Ontario).
  • Separately list each position held, including different positions with the same employer.
A resume may be attached to your application but will not substitute for the proper completion of your application. Applications that are not properly completed may be rejected.

Supplemental Questions

To complete your application for this position you will be prompted to respond to supplemental questions. This information will be used as part of the application screening and selection process and is designed to help you present your qualifications for this position. This may include a selection step in which your application and supplemental questions are reviewed and scored by a panel of raters familiar with this position.

Incomplete responses, false statements, omission, or partial information may result in disqualification from the selection process. Your responses should be consistent with the information provided on your application.

Please provide succinct, concise, descriptive, and detailed information for each question. If you have no experience, write "no experience" for the appropriate question.

Email Notices

Email is the primary way that the Human Resources or Hiring Department will communicate with you. Please check your email account (including the SPAM folder) on a regular basis for any emails related to the application or selection process. Emails from the city of Ontario will come from "@ontarioca.gov" or "governmentjobs.com." If you change your email address after submitting your application please visit governmentjobs.com and update your profile.

Frequently Asked Questions

If you have any additional questions regarding the application process, please refer to our Frequently Asked Questions

position: Intern, Chassis and Vehicle Dynamics, Fall 2021
description:
Leading the future of luxury mobility

Lucid's mission is to inspire the adoption of sustainable energy by creating the most captivating luxury electric vehicles, centered around the human experience. Working at Lucid Motors means having a shared vision to power the future in revolutionary ways. Be part of a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to transform the automotive industry.

We are actively seeking interns for our Chassis and Vehicle Dynamics team. Our ideal candidate exhibits a can-do attitude and approaches his or her work with vigor and determination. Candidates will be expected to demonstrate excellence in their respective fields, to possess the ability to learn quickly and to strive for perfection within a fast-paced environment. 

Responsibilities
    • Take one or more technical projects, related to suspension, steering, braking, wheels, tires, and/or vehicle dynamics, from idea through to completion
    • Apply data-driven, decision making, and teamwork, to solve complex problems and questions
    • Support other engineers on the team, in data collection and analysis, component/system, design, project management, and logistics, and prototype vehicle fleet, management
    • Ask questions, absorb learning, make the most of this opportunity to grow your skills and knowledge - we're here to help you as much as you're here to help us!
Qualifications
    • 0-3 Years of work or intern experience
    • Proven knowledge of how passenger vehicles, especially their suspension, steering, and braking systems, work
    • Experience with a CAD program

      • Preferred Qualifications

    • A desire to apply what you know, but also question every assumption
    • Experience in 3D design (CATIA, Solidworks, AutoCAD, Creo, etc) is a plus
    • Experience with CAN tools and data acquisition equipment is a plus
    • Experience with scripting languages/tools and methods to optimize data management is a plus
    • Experience with Formula SAE Electric,
Other
    • Programming Timing: September 7th - November 26th, 2021 (12 weeks); End date can be extended up to December 23rd, 2021 based on individual needs; Some flexibility with start date is available if needed
    • Availability: Full-time preferred but Part-Time available
    • Location: This position is in Newark, CA. You must be prepared to start on site for your first day of employment
    • Work Environment: Production Lab
    • Anticipated Hours: 8:30 am - 5:30 pm
    • Compensation: Student compensation is based on location and current degree level, non-negotiable
    • Visa Sponsorship: Lucid may but is not obligated to sponsor foreign national employees requiring company sponsorship for U.S. employment authorization
    • Medical benefits: Dental and vision on day 1 for all interns working 30+ hours a week; medical for interns in California working 30+ hours a week
    • Housing: No compensation for housing
    • Bonus: No signing bonus, relocation bonus, equity, or other bonuses currently
    • Relocation: Round trip flight from/to permanent residence
    • Housing/Transportation: You must provide your own living arrangements and transportation in the local area
    • Background Check: All offers of employment are contingent on clearing a background check
    • Publications: This internship may involve access to and/or knowledge of Lucid confidential and proprietary information. As a requirement of accepting an offer of employment with Lucid Motors, you will agree to keep all such information confidential and not disclose such information to any third party including but not limited to research papers, thesis, dissertation, school papers, or any other publication in any form without prior written approval from Lucid Legal Department.
Be part of something amazing

Come work alongside some of the most accomplished minds in the industry. Beyond providing competitive salaries, we're providing a community for innovators who want to make an immediate and significant impact. If you are driven to create a better, more sustainable future, then this is the right place for you.

At Lucid, we don't just welcome diversity - we celebrate it! Lucid Motors is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer.  We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity and expression, marital status, and any other characteristic protected under applicable State or Federal laws and regulations.

To all recruitment agencies: Lucid Motors does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our careers alias or other Lucid Motors employees. Lucid Motors is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

THE POSITION

This job postings is open continuously and may close at any time without prior notice
The City of Carson - Community Development Department is seeking current/recently graduated Planning/Urban Development/Geography students, who are are eager and passionate to learn about planning within the public sector. Interns will be exposed to various related fields, including California Environmental Quality Act (CEQA) for both Public and private projects.   Interns will be directly supervised and trained by professional planners, and will be expected to assist with Planning Division counter activities and special projects while becoming experienced with plan reviews and the processing of ministerial applications.. Also, interns will get the opportunity to collaborate with other City personnel on various projects.   The ideal candidate must be motivated and willing to engage others within a professional and dedicated planners and other staff members within the Planning Division. S/he must have successfully complete at least two to three relevant college courses, and preferably is at least at the junior level.  
  Position Information:
 This is a part-time at-will position (FLSA: non-exempt), limited to 960 hours per fiscal year.  Typical work schedule is between 7 am to 6 pm, Monday to Thursday.  Position will be classified in accordance with the selected candidate's qualifications.

  Required Documents:
All required documents must be submitted with the application at the time of submission.
  1. Resume
  2. Cover Letter, addressed to the Planning Manager, detailing why you are interested in the position
  3. Proof of relevant education (official or unofficial transcripts)
  4. Proof of current college/grad school enrollment (if applicable) 
Job Summary:
Under direction, performs entry level tasks relating to urban planning, zoning and community design.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES

(These functions are representative and may not be present in all positions in the class.  Management reserves the right to add, modify, change or rescind related duties and work assignments.)
  1. Performs research, compiles data and prepares reports related to municipal planning and zoning.
  2. Conducts surveys and studies and makes recommendations based on findings.
  3. Assists with file maintenance, data entry and generates reports using a variety of computer software programs.
  4. Prepares written correspondence.
  5. Participates in the preparation and revision of brochures, graphic materials, maps and other administrative materials.
  6. Works with other professional planning employees assigned to special work projects.
  7. Provides information to and consults with staff and the public on planning matters.
  8. Operates a variety of office machines, including a personal computer.
  9. Reads and interprets architectural drawings and maps.
  10. Attend meetings or events in the evening or on weekends.
  11. May drive to different locations to perform work, site inspections/surveys or attend meetings within and outside the City.
  12. Performs related duties as required.

QUALIFICATIONS

A typical way to obtain the requisite qualifications to perform the duties of this class is as follows:
 
Education and Experience:
Must be enrolled in a college or university as a senior or graduate student majoring in Planning, Architecture, Urban Studies or related field or must have graduated with a degree in Planning, Architecture, Urban Studies or related field within the last six months.

Knowledge of:
  • Modern English usage.
  • Mathematics, including statistics.
  • Research and analytical methods.
  • Personal computers and related software applications.
  • Principles of planning and urban development.
  • Methods of report presentation.

Skill and Ability to:

  • Compile, review and evaluate data.
  • Communicate effectively orally and in writing.
  • Read and interpret architectural drawings and maps.
  • Understand and carry out oral and written instructions.
  • Learn City organization, operations, policies and objectives.
  • Establish and maintain effective working relationships.
  • Deal tactfully with the public. 
License/Certificate:
Possession of a valid California Class C Drivers License.

WORKING CONDITIONS

Employee accommodations for physical or mental disabilities will be considered on a case-by-case basis.  Positions in this class normally:

  • Require vision (which may be corrected) to read small print.
  • Perform work which is primarily sedentary.
  • Are subject to inside environmental conditions.
  • May be required to use personal vehicle in the course of employment.
  • May be required to attend periodic evening meetings and/or to travel within and out of City boundaries to attend meetings.
  • May be required to work evenings or weekends.
RECRUITMENT PROCESS
 
Applications will be screened and evaluated for relevant training and experience.  Applications must be complete, and include any and all required documents. Only those applicants determined to be among the most qualified may be invited to participate in the recruitment process, which will consist of the following steps:
  1. Complete applications - including all required documents
  2. HR review for minimum qualifications
  3. SME review (100% weight)
This is an at-will position, with no permanency rights.

Revisions to the recruitment process can be made at the discretion of the Human Resources Department.  Applicants will be notified by email if a revision is made. 
 
OTHER INFORMATION

The City of Carson is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  Special assistance with the application and examination process is available, upon request, for persons with disabilities.  Call Human Resources for assistance at (310) 952-1736.
 
APPOINTMENT

Any offer of employment, or acceptance of an employment offer, is contingent upon passing live scan, background check and other tests.  All new employees are required to take a loyalty oath.
 
The provisions of this bulletin do not constitute an expressed or implied contract.  Any provisions contained herein may be modified or revoked without notice.  All statements made on the job application are subject to investigation and/or verification.  Inaccurate and/or false statements will be cause for disqualification, removal from the eligibility list or discharge from employment.
 
IMPORTANT NOTICE :  THIS POSITION IS OPEN AND INTERNAL.
 
CURRENT CITY OF CARSON EMPLOYEES

Please do not use your City of Carson email address as part of this application.  You must indicate a personal email address in order to receive communications and/or notices from Human Resources throughout the recruitment process.

Primary Purpose

SoCalGas is offering exciting new opportunities for hands-on training with skilled professionals. Student internships provide developmental opportunities for the right candidates, to put theory into practice and gain valuable work experience that is personally and professionally rewarding. Current enrollment in an engineering program as an undergraduate or graduate in a 4-year college or university. This is a year-round part time position and requires reliable transportation.

The Engineering Intern supports their department with reviews, analysis and recommendations for engineering requests from the field, planning office and headquarters. This position provides research support (data gathering utilizing company records stored in hard copy or computer form), engineering and cost benefit analysis for gas processing facility projects. Provides gas processing analysis support utilizing available simulation software.

Join SoCalGas today and share our vision of becoming the cleanest natural gas utility in North America. Headquartered in the heart of downtown Los Angeles, we deliver affordable and increasingly renewable energy to 22 million customers across central and Southern California.

Qualifications

  • Sophomore/Junior or Senior with at least two semesters or quarters before graduation.
  • Full-time student in a College or University Engineering program, in the chemical or mechanical engineering disciplines.
  • A 3.0 over all GPA or above is required and maintain the 3.0 throughout the internship.
  • Be able to work 16-20 hours per week on a year-round basis, with a flexible work schedule.
  • Solid understanding of fluid flow, thermal dynamics, piping systems and computer applications preferable.
  • Must be able to analyze significant amounts of data and develop multiple options and scenarios in reaching decisions.
  • Must be able to manage and implement multiple projects and to coordinate assigned activities and individual projects.
  • Knowledge of project management software tools, PC operations, spreadsheets, CAD, mainframe, networks, and MS Office preferable.
  • Must clearly and concisely communicate technical information and concepts in formal and informal settings with other departments in the company.
  • Strong communications skills. This position requires constant communication with people of various levels of work experience; must be willing to learn from others, be self-motivated to perform tasks that are simple or complex.
 

Southern California Gas Company is an EEO/AA Employer

position: Strategic Student Program: Application Support Intern (T&I; Fall 2021; SISW-PLM)
description:
Strategic Student Program (SSP) Discover your career with us at Siemens Software! We are a leading global software company dedicated to the world of product lifecycle management; from computer aided design, to 3D modeling and simulation- helping innovative global manufacturers design better products, faster! With the resources of a large company, and the energy of a software start-up, we have fun together while creating a world class software portfolio.

Our culture encourages creativity, welcomes fresh thinking and focuses on growth, so our people, our business, and our customers can achieve their full potential. We're currently recruiting students for our Fall 2021 Strategic Student Program. Our intern and co-op positions will allow you to find a career path that most inspires you.

Here, you will apply your education to solve real-world problems, and turn theory into practice. At Siemens, our goal is to empower our students to become the next leaders of our company. We have positions available in software development, user experience, data management, technical marketing, engineering consulting, and research & design innovation.

More information on our specific roles are included in this document. Baseline Requirements: Currently enrolled as an undergraduate student Minimum 3.0 GPA Authorized to work in the United States without the need for current or future sponsorship by the company Preferred junior or senior status Able to work a maximum of 25 hours during the Fall 2021 semester Perks: Victorious daily ping pong tournaments Paid volunteer time off Employee discounts at our top customer sites Networking with our global leaders Mentorship from senior engineers Individual career development planning Professional and technical workshops Energetic student community Leadership opportunities Potential for full time offers after university graduation and completion of the program Technology & Innovation (T&I) Application Support Intern As part of our architecture team in T&I, you will become immersed in innovation and research activities with our group. We work with new technologies and partners initiatives that add additional capabilities to our portfolio typically using NX, Teamcenter and others as data sources.

These capabilities are developed with focus on engineering data leveraging technologies around data inference, data science and data blending. In this role, you will work with SW portfolio architects to use new technologies to create new insights that will support development of new capabilities. The intern will champion projects to: Work on a team in an agile development environment Work collaboratively with internal business clients to understand their needs and build solutions to address them Work with on-premise and cloud technology Populate data warehouses and data lakes with data from inhouse systems Produce and consume APIs Write scripts if required to address temporary needs Debug, troubleshoot and fix issues Organization Requirements: Currently enrolled in a university pursuing an undergraduate or master's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, IT, or a related field Exceptional written and verbal communication skills Experience with Java, Javascript, and Python Experience with Machine Learning, Data Warehouse, Natural Language Processing, or Ontologies is a plus Experience with data analytics tools such as Power BI or Tableau Result-driven, detail-oriented Eager learner and team player Works well under pressure Driven and self-motivated Working knowledge of AWS is preferred but not required Organization: Digital Industries Company: Siemens Industry Software Inc.

Experience Level: Student (Not Yet Graduated) Job Type: Part-time Equal Employment Opportunity Statement Siemens is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, creed, religion, national origin, citizenship status, ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability unrelated to ability, marital status, family responsibilities, pregnancy, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity, transgender, sex stereotyping, order of protection status, protected veteran or military status, or an unfavorable discharge from military service, and other categories protected by federal, state or local law. EEO is the Law Applicants and employees are protected under Federal law from discrimination.

To learn more, Click here. Pay Transparency Non-Discrimination Provision Siemens follows Executive Order 11246, including the Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision. To learn more, Click here.

California Privacy Notice California residents have the right to receive additional notices about their personal information. To learn more, click here.

The Position

Environmental Programs Intern   The City of Ontario reserves the right, if necessary, to accept only the first one hundred (100) applications from applicants that meet the qualification guidelines below.

Are you interested in making a positive impact on your community while developing professional skills in the areas of municipal utilities environmental programs? The City of Ontario has an excellent part-time opportunity for an Environmental Programs Intern to assist in and complete a wide variety of administrative, technical, and research-oriented assignments. Interns have the ability to observe in and participate in a variety of tasks that support the overall operation of the Ontario Municipal Utilities Company Environmental Programs Division.   The ideal candidate shall have knowledge of basic engineering principles, as they relate to protection of the environment and the health and safety of the public. The intern will work with a team involved in preparing wastewater discharge permits issued to industrial users, performing monitoring and regulatory compliance activities, initiating enforcement activities to ensure industrial user compliance, education outreach, data management and analysis, and field work. Knowledge of principles of mathematics, biology, chemistry, and other scientific disciplines are important in order to perform the duties. The ideal candidate will have a basic understanding of the operation and maintenance of municipal utilities; the capability to use MS Office software programs; the ability to compile and organize data and create reports and spreadsheets; and perform other essential functions as required. In addition, the candidate will have the ability to work effectively and efficiently in a team environment. Additionally, the successful candidate will be a model for the City's Approach to Public Service - Commitment to the Community, Achieving Excellence Through Teamwork, and Doing the Right Thing the Right Way - and emulate the qualities of a 5 Tool Player - Leader, Thinker, Operator, Communicator, and Public Servant.    The Administrative Intern is a part-time/temporary position, scheduled to work less than 29 hours per week, and is not eligible to participate in the City's health insurance or retirement plans.   The City of Ontario 
  The City of Ontario is a dynamic leading community in the Inland Empire with a variety of full-time and part-time employment and volunteer opportunities. Ontario enjoys the reputation of being a progressive City which provides solid leadership to its citizens and to the business community. The City provides a full range of services to the community including; Police, Fire, Administrative Services, Community Life & Culture, Development, Economic Development, Housing & Neighborhood Preservation, Public Works and the Ontario Municipal Utilities Company. The City's team is staffed with approximately 1,200 full-time and 200 part-time diverse and talented employees who work to support a common goal of providing excellent service to the community.

We invite you to learn more about the City of Ontario by reviewing the City's website. A few useful links are also listed below:

Approach to Public Service (Core values for City of Ontario employees)

OntarioCityEmployees.org (Information about City of Ontario employee benefit plans)

The Ontario Plan (The City's Comprehensive Business Plan for Development)

Examples of Essential Functions

The essential functions typically performed by the Environmental Programs Intern include the following:


  • Performs customer service-related activities, assigns billing codes, prepares reports, manages data, reviews wastewater pretreatment and business permit applications and tracks them.
  • Assists with compliance activities and performs other administrative program related work to assist with the operations of the Environmental Programs Division.
  • Assists members of management, professional, and technical staff by performing basic administrative and technical assignments.
  • Utilizes Geographical Information Systems for data analysis.
  • Operates personal computers, printers, and other office equipment.
  • Performs research and preliminary administrative analysis.
  • Performs field work when requested of commercial and industrial users.
  • Reviews and comments on publications and documents.
  • Composes and edits correspondence, memorandums, reports, and other special assignments.
  • Gathers and tabulates data.
  • Responds to requests for information and general questions from the public.
  • Prepares files for storage.
  • Assists with specials projects and events.
  • Performs other related duties as assigned.

Qualification Guidelines

Education

Equivalent to completion of two years of college at an accredited college/university with major course work in Engineering, Environmental Science, or a related field.

Licenses

Valid California Class C driver's license and an acceptable driving record at the time of appointment and throughout employment.

Desirable

Currently enrolled as a junior/senior level undergraduate student, in good standing, at an accredited college/university with a major emphasis in Civil Engineering, Environmental Science or a related field.

Supplemental Information

How to Apply

Apply online by clicking on the "Apply" link at the top of this announcement. If this is the first time applying for a position using governmentjobs.com you will be prompted to create a new user account, otherwise log in with your user name and password. Your application and responses to any supplemental questions will be used to evaluate your qualifications for this position. It is suggested that your application include the following:
 

  • List any relevant experience and education that demonstrates that you qualify for the position.
  • List all periods of employment for at least the past 10 years, beginning with your most recent or present employer (including if applicable, all employment with the City of Ontario).
  • Separately list each position held, including different positions with the same employer.
A resume may be attached to your application but will not substitute for the proper completion of your application. Applications that are not properly completed may be rejected.

Supplemental Questions

To complete your application for this position you will be prompted to respond to supplemental questions. This information will be used as part of the application screening and selection process and is designed to help you present your qualifications for this position. This may include a selection step in which your application and supplemental questions are reviewed and scored by a panel of raters familiar with this position.

Incomplete responses, false statements, omission, or partial information may result in disqualification from the selection process. Your responses should be consistent with the information provided on your application.

Please provide succinct, concise, descriptive, and detailed information for each question. If you have no experience, write "no experience" for the appropriate question.

Email Notices

Email is the primary way that the Human Resources or Hiring Department will communicate with you. Please check your email account (including the SPAM folder) on a regular basis for any emails related to the application or selection process. Emails from the city of Ontario will come from "@ontarioca.gov" or "governmentjobs.com." If you change your email address after submitting your application please visit governmentjobs.com and update your profile.

Frequently Asked Questions

If you have any additional questions regarding the application process, please refer to our Frequently Asked Questions

SUMMARY: This position is responsible for maintaining internal reports using Microsoft Office applications internal systems and external databases including IRI Spectra Mintel NPD ; creating ad hoc reports; running errands for the department - trips to Sam s etc; making copies filing etc; ordering samples for sales presentations; and any other project needs of the marketing managers on the team. Based on initiative this position offers the potential for exposure to accounting systems sales analysis and a financial perspective; customer service; large corporate environment; consumer packaged goods marketing experience; business planning; and enhancement of computer skills. REQUIREMENTS: Education: Incoming junior senior or MBA at least one year of school remaining . Business or Animal Science majors preferred. Experience: Previous work experience in any field. Computer Skills: Strong computer skills with a working knowledge of Excel familiarity with Access Word and PowerPoint. Supervisory: None Special Skills: Ability to multitask; motivated self-starter.

Work Shift:

1ST SHIFT (United States of America)

When completing a Tyson Foods employment application, be sure to complete all tasks listed on the candidate home page. If not, you will see a message that there are 1 or more task(s) that require attention. Applicants for hourly production positions must complete the task to provide additional information to be considered from employment.

Tyson is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, national origin, color, religion, age, genetics, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

CCPA Notice. If you are a California resident, and would like to learn more about what categories of personal information we collect when you apply for this job, and how we may use that information, please read our CCPA Job Applicant Notice at Collection, click here.
